name: Alexander Lim

jobs.title: Web and GUI Developer Intern
descriptions: Built a real-time web dashboard for monitoring scripts running on various servers, reducing the reliance on e-mail for receiving alerts.
Worked on a Django web application for browsing trade summary data and TCAs.
Built Qt GUIs to monitor live trading engine data.
Built a relay in C++ to relay market data from several upstream servers to multiple clients, reducing network load.

jobs.title: Agile Engineering Intern - iOS Development
descriptions: Built AccuWeather for iOS 7, a weather app providing detailed forecasts and a UI designed for the new OS.
Localized the app across more than a dozen languages.
Used MapKit to render and animate radar tile overlays on an interactive map.

jobs.title: Agile Engineering Intern - iOS Development
descriptions: Worked on Cypress, a file management application on the iPhone and iPad that synchronizes local storage with Sharepoint, Dropbox, and Box.
Worked on Karmaloop, a shopping application on the iPhone with support for credit card scanning and social integration.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Intern
descriptions: Wrote JMeter scripts to test an enterprise web application.
Proposed and implemented a Java utility to pull bugs from Bugzilla and update Excel spreadsheets.

projects.name: OMG UW
descriptions: A site that lets students anonymously share, rate, and comment on stories, missed connections, and questions about the University of Waterloo.
Joined the 3-person team at the end of April 2014, responsible for fixing technical issues and moderating submissions and comments.
Receives 250,000+ page views, 1,000+ submissions, and 1,500+ comments a month, backed by Google's Blogger platform.
